headline: Quick and Easy Chicken Noodle Soup
description: This easy chicken noodle soup recipe made with veggies and leftover chicken is warm, comforting, and ready to ladle into bowls in just over 30 minutes.

video.description: See how to make hearty chicken noodle soup in just 30 minutes.
video.name: Quick and Easy Chicken Noodle Soup

name: Quick and Easy Chicken Noodle Soup
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion and celery and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes.
Add chicken broth, vegetable broth, chicken, egg noodles, carrots, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I don't use a recipe for chicken soup, noodle or rice. This is very close to what I use except I wouldn't use anything but the rotisserie chicken or chicken thighs. Both of these give the best flavor.

This simple chicken noodle soup is a staple at our house. My kids LOVE it. It's quick, easy, and delicious. I follow the recipe exactly, though sometimes I add extra carrots or celery. I personally use 1/2 tsp of salt and 1/4 tsp of pepper.
I think it‚Äôd taste a lot better just as a soup, no noodles. But it‚Äôs lovely! The noodles soak up a lot of the broth so if you want more soup, use less noodles.
Delicious!! Very flavorful. Made recipe as is. Used rotisserie chicken from store. Probably added more than called for as I don‚Äôt know how much 1/2 pound is. Easy to whip on a cold winter day.
Love love love it! Especially for these unusual rainy nights here in Southern California! Thanks for sharing recipe!
It was good and liked the simplicity of making it but I would have loved more flavor. I may try to add some fresh herbs next time.

I needed a quick soup for my hubby who wasn‚Äôt feeling too well. I only had about half the chicken broth. I boiled a frozen chicken breast in the broth. Then strained the broth because there‚Äôs always floaties when you boil raw chicken. Cut the breast off the bone. Followed the rest of the recipe, and I thought it was amazing!! Thank you for such an easy tasty recipe.
Very easy and one of my favorites!

So easy and tasted great. My husband loved it as did my Dad. I used two 12.5 oz cans of shredded chicken meat instead of cooking chicken breast. Made it even easier to make and there was chicken in every spoonful. Thanks for sharing!

It was easy to make. I didn't have carrots so I substituted frozen okra and peas. I'm always timid about adding Italian spices to my soups, so I always measure these out. Thank you from Cleveland, Ohio!
I really liked it. Could use some more seasoning. My husband is diabetic so I had to make some changes and couldn't go entirely according to directions.
This is my go to recipe for basic chicken noodle. So easy to follow this as a base and add rotisserie or any other ingredients. Love the simplicity and thankful to have a great jump off point.
Great basic recipe, especially for quick & easy. Assuming readers have common sense ü§≠ Taste throughout üòã Thanks for sharing üòÅ

This was fantastic!! I used canned chicken because I was in a massive hurry- someone asked if I could bring some soup who had covid. I did double the spices and I added poultry seasoning and garlic powder. It got rave reviews!! Many thanks!

Delicious!! I made this for myself when I was down bad with a cold, and it's so tasty and comforting. It's simple, but high-quality ingredients really bring it to the next level. The only change I made was adding a little bit of sage.

I used this recipe as my base, then I added a package of frozen soup veggies with Tyson's Grilled & Ready Oven Roasted Diced Chicken Breast. I followed the instructions for the soup veggies and served it with crackers. It was especially enjoyed by the extremely picky eaters in the household.
Easy peasy good!

I especially liked this recipe because the ingredients include basics that most people have in their refrigerator . I had leftover chicken, broth, celery and carrots. Also a half bag of dry noodles. used poultry seasoning and the better than bouillon chicken broth. I also used the better than bouillon vegetable broth too. I had poultry seasoning and used that also. . Turned out very well.!!! Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.!!!

Very bland‚Ä¶ I think the recipe itself could‚Äôve been pulled together better also.. you says saut√© in butter, but how much? As this can change the flavor.. anyways I found this to be a very bland tasteless recipe. Ended up trying to salt to taste them over salted.. found another recipe that was amazing. I give this one 2 stars just bc I‚Äôm being nice
Followed the recipe to the tee but doubled down on the noodles. Is a great soup for the soul. Doug
Easy to make and delicious

so great. Didn‚Äôt have vegetable stock so I just used half a cup of white wine and a half a cup of liquid bullion, chicken. I also didn‚Äôt have basil so I used dried tarragon. I always use that with chicken dishes. Threw in some garlic salt too!
We all loved the taste of the chicken noodle soup was! Easiest recipe for anyone to use! I did double the basil and oregano.
So easy to make and so delicious! I buy a Rotisserie chicken which adds even more flavor and even easier to make!
Delicious! Easy to make and good for colds.
I made chicken broth with vegetables instead of using canned. Much more work but delicious. I doubled the recipe and used most of the meat from the chicken I used for the broth. It's very flavorful.
Loved it. Used bouillon cubes instead of chicken stock and came out wonderful. Perfect fix for a cold.
This one is awesome. This is going on the favorites list.
I used Italian seasoning and chicken bone broth as others suggested. Additionally, I used 2 garlic cloves (minced). It‚Äôs a great recipe I‚Äôll be sure to make again.
Really comforting and easy to make! Perfect for a cold night!
Fast, easy and great.
Didn't have any seasoning other than salt and pepper. Only had chicken broth so I basically just did that for 3.5 cups. Added water later on because I added too much pepper.

Loved this! So easy and very tasty. The only change I made was substitute Italian seasoning for the oregano which I do for any recipe that calls for oregano. I am giving it 4 stars beca As is the noodles are way over cooked. Next time I‚Äôll simmer for 10 minutes then add the noodles for the last 10 minutes. Otherwise perfect!
Used one carton bone broth and 1/2 carton vegetable stock, lemon pepper rotisserie chicken, canned carrots. Minced garlic, parsley, thyme. So good!

I loved it! I used equal parts chicken and vegetable broth and frozen carrots and (literally)forgot the celery... I made it for my daughter who has a cough and was trying to get it to come together quickly. I added 1/2 tsp of crushed red pepper flakes. Everything else was according to the recipe. Just what we needed!
Quick and easy. I added garlic, extra chicken and extra noodles.

This was so easy and extremely tasty!! The whole family moaned when they heard soup lol, but they devoured it and not drop was left!! I did cook my onions, celery and carrots in the butter first then added raw chicken thyme and poultry season to the broth and let it simmer for over an hour. I added the egg noodles to each bowl then topped it with parm cheese. This will be my go to chicken noodle soup from now on!!
No changes. It was delicious. My wife loved it. She was sick and she wanted a pot of chicken noodle soup the last a few days. Had trouble printing it though. But we made it through. Thank you
Seems easy

It really exceeded my expectations for a "basic" chicken noodle soup, so I'm giving it 5 stars. I browned the whole chicken breasts in the pot first, took them out, then cooked carrots and celery until barely soft. Put onions and butter in, cooked until slightly browned, then put everything else back in, including double oregano and basil. Simmered for 20 minutes, then took chicken out and cubed it. Put noodles and chicken in and served when noodles were soft. Fantastic.
Didn't make any changes and will make it again! Used roasted chicken from Costo.
I loved trying this recipe. I used my air fryer for making the chicken. Would make again.
I did not have celery, I used egg noodles, and in lieu of vegetable broth I tried beef broth. I will have a taste rating later but for ease of recipe I used a 4.
It was delicious! I added noodles into the soup. What a great recipe. I used a rotisserie Chicken. Definitely would make it again!

Perfect. I made it with canned chicken breast from Sam's Club. Reading some of the reviews did the noodles separately. Good advice. Thanks folks. Added some low sodium Vegeta and pepper with a bit of Italian seasoning. Didn't have oregano or basil. It was wonderful. Thank you so much for the easy recipe.
This recipe was super simple and delicious! I added a teaspoon of chicken bouillon and used a mirepoix as my vegetable base. Kids loved it too‚Ä¶and that‚Äôs all that matters!
The soup turned out amazing! The only thing I did different, I used gluten-free noodles.

Great easy recipe. I made this with leftover turkey from Thanksgiving, and it was pretty amazing. Wife was impressed as well.

I increased the amount of noodles to 2 cups, rather than 1 1/2, and there was still A LOT of leftover broth, so I'd definitely recommend adding more noodles. I think next time I might actually do 3 cups of noodles, even. I added a half a can of cream of chicken soup, like someone else here had suggested, and I think it really helped. As a matter of fact, I'll probably do a whole can of cream of chicken next time. I also substituted the salt and pepper with Tony's creole seasoning, because I do that with just about everything. ;)

Overall, it was a hit, maybe even literally the best chicken (turkey) noodle soup I've ever had. I'll absolutely be making this many times in the future.
Pretty good soup. My wife and I liked it. Will be making it again.
My family loves it! I always add dumplings!
Great recipe - definitely a keeper - it‚Äôs everything it‚Äôs says and even better
This recipe is both easy and delicious. Thanks

Fantastic recipe! I cooked it in the slow cooker as follows. I doubled the recipe, except I only used 2 boneless, skinless chicken breast and I just ended up using a whole 8 oz package of egg noodles because we like a lot of noodles. I sauteed the onions, celery, and carrots in a cast iron skillet with butter and just a little broth, until the carrots were tender, then added to the broth (I used chicken broth only, as that was what I had on hand) in the slow cooker. I then cut up my chicken breasts and added those. Besides the listed seasonings I also added maybe a tsp of poultry seasoning, a heaping teaspoon of minced garlic (jarred, in water) and about a tsp of dried marjoram, since I was out of thyme. I cooked the noodles separately, added them to the soup when it was done, (about 5-6 hours on High), and let the soup in slow cooker return to a boil and let the noodles boil with the soup for 10 or 15 minutes. I will be adding this to my regular rotation. So good and comforting, thanks for sharing!
Really good recipe. It has great flavor on it's own, and look forward to adding different things and seeing what else can be brought to it. Excellent.
Such a nice recipe. I omitted the onions and added potatoes because that's what I had on hand. I will definitely make this again!
This is truly the best Chicken Noodle Soup I have ever tasted. I make a ton of it and freeze it.
DELICIOUS, AND VERY EASY!! I made this for my mother in law and family, and BOY was it a hit! It was gone in 45 minutes!! You should definitely try this!! Soooo good and soooo easy!
Tasted fine, but when I changed the serving amount from 6 to 12, the amount of noodles went from 1 1/2 cups of noodles to 1/3 cup plus 2 teaspoons. Needs correcting!!

I made to recipe and would have only given that 3 stars. Too bland/boring. So, made some tweaks based on other reviews and personal taste and now it‚Äôs a staple. Dbl celery and carrots. Use 2 32 oz containers of chicken BONE broth (very important) and 1 of veggie stock. Also 1 can of heart healthy cream of chicken soup to thicken it up a bit. Also dbl oregano, basil and added same amount of poultry seasoning. 2 cups noodles. Use chicken breast or chicken thighs to taste. We like a lot of chicken.
Easy as advertised. Love it. Made for the wife.
It was delicious, but next time I won't add as much oregano and basil.

So good and super fast and easy. I made a couple substitutions with what I had on hand. I saut√©ed butter, garlic, carrots, and celery for 3-5 min until softened and then added chicken broth, shredded rotisserie chicken breast and couscous. Brought to boil and then simmered 20 min covered as recipe suggested. Will definitely be making this again!!!!

I made 2 changes. I added 2 cups of spinach in the last 2-3 minutes of simmering. I didn‚Äôt have vegetable broth, so I added a can of cream corn instead. It was great and even my 12 & 16 year olds ate it!

Made this today and LOVED IT. I doubled the recipe, I saut√©ed all the veggies along with some minced garlic in the butter. I used all chicken broth and I did not add the egg noodles until the last 9 minutes of boiling time. That is really key. You don‚Äôt want mushy noodles so begin the 20 minute boiling time and add egg noodles when you have 8-9 minutes left or according to the package directions. This is such a fast, easy and flavorful soup, thank you!
Sauteed veggies in butter & garlic. added extra oregano, pepper and poultry seasoning. Absolutely delicious.
Great, easy soup. My family loved it. Made it GF by using cooked rice in place of noodles. Definitely will be a repeat recipe this winter.
Definitely a keeper. Will make again for sure!!

This is my go-to recipe for a quick chicken noodle soup meal. It works well as is and I recommend the recipe. I usually enhance it a bit by using a good chicken stock instead of broth, then adding 1 tsp (not Tbsp) Better Than Bullion Chicken concentrate. I don't like the texture of cooked carrots so I cut them into large chunks and remove them before serving. I also simmer till cooked through about 10 lbs of fresh boneless skinless chicken breasts at a time in chicken broth and the stated seasonings, vacuum seal and refreeze 1 lb portions of them for future use. I usually get 4 to 5 servings this way. Because of the pandemic, I shop in bulk and freeze.

For vegetarians out there, like me, I used a package of Sweet Earth Mindful Chikn and Better Than Bullion? No Chicken Chicken Broth. I also added more veggies and noodles. It was deeelicious!!! I will make it again.
Simply put, delicious!
Delicious

I used our Thanksgiving Turkey leftovers for this soup and my husband went absolutely insane over it. I pretty much followed the ingredients exactly only I needed more of everything since I used more vegetables and all of the meat we had left. I added a touch of celery salt as well. This was the best soup my husband has ever had, according to him!
Easy, quick soup. Made 5-ish servings.

Great recipe! This is about as "from scratch" as I'm ever going to get, and it's super easy with great flavor. I didn't have vegetable broth, so I used all chicken and was still delicious. Have now made many times: works great with leftover Turkey and freezes well.
I liked it a lot! Super easy and healthy. I added some rosemary and extra spices to add some more seasoning. Overall, good!

Rave reviews from elderly clients and neighbors that I shared this soup with, telling me this was the best chicken soup they've ever had. I used the packaged white meat rotisserie chicken from Costco and my broth was Better Than Bullion (chicken) in the same liquid quantities in the recipe. This recipe is a keeper and I already have requests to make it again.
Love it, so quick and easy that taste amazing

Super good flavor and super easy recipe. Used a store bought rotisserie chicken and didn‚Äôt have exact seasonings on hand so I used some Italian seasoning that I had and it was absolutely delicious. I did cook the carrots with the onion and celery to make sure they softened up.
Very easy and delicious. Perfect for a cold day. If you change anything on the recipe then you didn‚Äôt make it .
This was so good and easy to make. The flavor is great!!!!!!! We ate

This is a great base recipe. My toddler loves it. I add in a variety of herbs including sage, parsley, tarragon, rosemary, oregano, thyme, basil, and marjoram. Yum! This is also my go to when I don't feel good. It is so easy to make and perfect comfort food on a cold day.
Our go to during the fall/winter. Make a large batch to last a few meals

I just ended up eating this. It was delicious. It was easy to make. Very easy. I think I will add more carrots and celery next time. I used 2 cups of noodles because I just love egg noodles. I was really pleased with how it turned out.
In a word.... DELICIOUS!
Delicious & super easy to make. Thank you!

Loved this!! Didn't have any homemade broth and had no intentions of making any. 
I used left over chicken I had roasted whole in the oven, shredded it by hand. Since my chicken was already cooked, I added it after the soup started to simmer and left it in for a few minutes onces it started to boil to make sure all of it was heated through. 
Also I didn't have a celery so I just omitted that, but I did add a whole head of finely minced garlic and sauteed it with the carrots and onions. I used shallots, it's what I had and it was a nice sweet addition and will do it again in the furture. I didn't have dried basil so I used a few bay leaves (mine were quite small) and it was wonderful. I did add quite a bit of salt to mine, but my boxed broths were all low salt (they were the only ones on sale and Jebus knows I own plenty of salt). 
I also did freeze these in plastic liter containers without the noodle as someone else mentioned, and it's wonderful!! Easy to destroy and a large enough portion that it's enough to give to my boyfriend for work, and have some left over my own dinner later that night.

Love love love this recipe and everyone's suggestions. Not trying to change it, just suggesting substitutions in case others dont have extra these ingredients!
Love it. I also added some parsley. Quick and easy.
Perfect as it is
Excellent and easy recipe! I used rotisserie chicken and added extra noodles and veggies. My husband and son ask me to make this often.
It is really good better I made it a chicken noodle soup so good
Very easy to make. Always turns out great!
Used low salt broth.

I love this recipe although I did change it up a bit! I put my veggies in a food processor then sauted then and 1 tablespoon of minced garlic in about 2 tablespoons of butter. I cooked chicken tenderloins in water and added the soup base to it. Then cut chicken up added egg noodle to my chicken broth water boiled for 6 mins then added chicken and sauted veggies. Yummy!
So perfect!!!
Best by far and super easy!
Easy to make and delicious!
I made it with basmati rice and basil and from my garden and it's delicious! Actually, it tastes better than I thought it would.
I actually didn't use any veggie broth in mine and i put about 7 ounces of water in it. It's super good and my family loves it! I also put a little bit of thyme and chives in there too.
This is my go to chicken noodle soup recipe. It‚Äôs so easy and so perfect. Exactly what chicken noodle soup should be.

item.name: Quick and Easy Chicken Noodle Soup
